title: Quiz 8: Theoretical Approaches to Counselling
description: Differentiate between the four main theoretical approaches to counselling.

questions.question: Match the theoretical approach to its key concept:
questions.explanation: Freud = Past/Unconscious; Rogers = Self; Skinner = Learning; Lazarus = Multimodal.
questions.hint: Link the theory to its main focus.

questions.question: Which theory views the human being as a 'blank slate' born to learn behavior?
questions.explanation: Behavioural theory posits that we are blank slates and all behavior is learned (and can be unlearned).

questions.question: In the BASIC ID acronym for the Eclectic approach, 'C' stands for ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: BASIC ID: Behaviour, Affect, Sensation, Imagery, Cognition, Interpersonal, Drugs.

questions.question: What is 'Incongruence' in the Person-centred approach?

options.text: When self-conception differs from the reality of experience

questions.explanation: Incongruence is the gap between how we see ourselves (or want to be) and our actual experience.

questions.question: Which of the following are the three core conditions in Person-centred counselling? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Rogers identified Empathy, Unconditional Positive Regard, and Genuineness/Respect as core conditions.

questions.question: The Psychoanalytic approach focuses primarily on the 'here and now'.
questions.explanation: Psychoanalytic focuses on the PAST and the unconscious. Behavioural focuses on the here and now.
questions.hint: Think about Freud digging up the past.

questions.question: Who developed the Eclectic or Multimodal approach?
questions.explanation: Arnold Lazarus developed the Multimodal/Eclectic approach (BASIC ID).

questions.question: In Howard's derivations from Freud, it is assumed that human beings are:

options.text: Always conscious of what they are doing
Not always conscious of what they are doing

questions.explanation: Freud assumed we are often unaware (unconscious) of our motives and actions.

questions.question: What are objectives of Behavioural Therapy? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Behavioural therapy fixes current behavior and teaches skills, rather than exploring the past.
